title: Ticket #7441: Schedd should reject attempts to set Owner attribute of a job to root
description:
condor_submit will refuse to submit a job as root, but the python bindings submit can bypass that check. The Schedd will never run a job as root, but if one exists in the schedd, it will repeatedly get matched and attempt to run.

This wastes the Schedd's time.

The Schedd should have a submit-time check that prevents any attempt to set the Owner attribute of a job to root to prevent this waste of effort and reject submissions that attempt to submit as root regardless of what submission method is used.
